Elevator Speech.body: I am a web and software developer who specializes in creating dynamic, modern web applications. I specialize in the MERN stack and have been using it since 2016. I am looking for entry level positions with a company that encourages mentorship. I hope to take on projects that will challenge and teach me while also providing opportunities to helpfully contribute to a team effort.

Currently.body: I am hoping to find an entry-level developer position in the Raleigh-Durham area. I have built full stack applications in the past; both front-end and back-end positions are suitable. As a self-taught developer coming from a business/marketing background, I hope to find a mentor who will point out the weak areas of my technical knowledge.

Career.body: My short-term career goals are to find a position with a company that will help me grow as a developer through challenging projects and exposure to the various aspects of web development. My long term goals are to gain enough experience to become a software architect and consult individuals and companies on how to tackle their web and software challenges.

Work/Life.body: I have honest expectations of what my work/life balance will be in an entry-level developer position, and look forward to an opportunity to learn through immersion. Once I have “earned my stripes,” I hope to have a normal forty-hour workweek. The option to work remotely would be nice, however I am not requiring that in the positions I consider.

Web/Software Development.body: First introduced to programming during my sophomore year at NCSU, I have followed a path of self-education, using NCSU's Computer Science B.S. standard course track as a guide to the areas of study I needed to focus on. Using a combination of textbooks, online courses, and practice problems and projects, I believe I have gained a solid foundational knowledge of computer programming in general and of web development in particular. Following graduating from college, I was able to pursue my studies more earnestly after taking a bartending position that allowed for a large amount of flexibility in my schedule.

Dauntless Discovery.header: Dauntless Discovery - Data Analyst - Morrisville, NC
Dauntless Discovery.body: I took on a data analyst position at a law firm subsidiary company, where I investigated information systems compromised by bad actors. My main responsibilities involved identifying what types of personal information were contained in the compromised data and who was affected. This required critical interpretation of information in the context of business, financial, legal, medical, technological, and educational information systems. I left on amicable terms with the company due to a lack of consistent work and my freelance work requiring an increasing amount of my time.

Greenville Convention Center.body: I began working as a bartender shortly following my graduation from NCSU in May 2016. Over the course of two and a half years, I took on more and more responsibilities to the point where I often had my manager's keys more often than he did. I left on excellent terms with the company when my girlfirend took a promotion with her company that required moving to Raleigh, NC. This position was critical to developing my programming abilities, as it allowed me to commit considerably more time to study than would have otherwise been possible in a more traditional position.

Books.body: Programming Concepts: Design Patterns - Clean Code - Code - Automate The Boring Stuff With Python - Pro MERN Stack | Design/UX/UI: Things That Make Us Smart - The Design of Everyday Things | Development/Planning: Software Requirements
